# Cartogram
## Contiguous

A cartogram is a map in which the geometry of regions is distorted in order to convey the information of an alternate variable. The region area will be inflated or deflated according to its numeric value.

***

```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, echo=TRUE, results="hide", class.source = 'fold-hide'}

# Remove uninhabited regions
wrld <- spTransform(wrld_simpl[wrld_simpl$POP2005 > 0,], CRS("+init=epsg:3395"))

# Example filtering for Africa
# afr <- spTransform(wrld_simpl[wrld_simpl$REGION==2 & wrld_simpl$POP2005 > 0,], CRS("+init=epsg:3395"))

# Create cartogram
wrld_carto <- cartogram_cont(wrld, "POP2005", 3)


```


# Section
## Subsection


```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, echo=TRUE, results="hide", class.source = 'fold-hide'}

# Same with sf objects
wrld_sf = st_as_sf(wrld)
wrld_sf_carto <- cartogram_cont(wrld_sf, "POP2005", 3)

```


# Section
## original


```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, echo=TRUE, class.source = 'fold-hide', fig.width=12, fig.height=6}

# theme parameters
theme_opts <- theme(
  legend.position = "none",
  legend.title = element_blank(),
  axis.text = element_blank(),
  axis.line = element_blank(),
  axis.ticks = element_blank(),
  axis.title = element_blank(),
  panel.grid = element_blank(),
  panel.grid.major = element_blank(),
  panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
  panel.background=element_rect(fill="white", colour="white"),
  panel.border = element_blank(),
  plot.background = element_blank(),
)

v1 <- ggplot(data = wrld_sf) +
  # map feature styling
  geom_sf(fill="#ffffff", color="#333333", stroke=0.5) +
  theme_bw() +
  coord_sf() +
  labs(x="Longitude",
       y="Latitude",
       title = "Contiguous Cartogram", 
       subtitle="Scale by Population") +
  theme_opts

# v1

girafe( ggobj = v1, width_svg = 12, height_svg = 6,
  options = list( opts_sizing(rescale = TRUE) )
)

```


## distorted


```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, echo=TRUE, class.source = 'fold-hide', fig.width=12, fig.height=6}

v2 <- ggplot(data = wrld_sf_carto) +
  # map feature styling
  geom_sf(fill="#ffffff", color="#333333", stroke=0.5) +
  coord_sf() +
  theme_bw() +
  labs(x="Longitude",
       y="Latitude",
       title = "Contiguous Cartogram", 
       subtitle="Scale by Population") +
  theme_opts

# v2

girafe( ggobj = v2, width_svg = 12, height_svg = 6,
  options = list( opts_sizing(rescale = TRUE) )
)

```


## compared


```{r, message=FALSE, warning=FALSE, echo=TRUE, class.source = 'fold-hide', fig.width=12, fig.height=6}

# color palette to use
pal <- wes_palette("Zissou1", 10, type = "continuous")

v3 <- ggplot() +
  # map feature styling
  geom_sf(data = wrld_sf, fill="#ffffff", color="#333333", stroke=0.5) +
  geom_sf(data = wrld_sf_carto, aes(fill=POP2005), color="#ffffff", stroke=0.5) +
  scale_color_gradientn(colours = rev(pal)) + 
  scale_fill_gradientn(colours = rev(pal)) + 
  coord_sf() +
  theme_bw() +
  labs(x="Longitude",
       y="Latitude",
       title = "Contiguous Cartogram", 
       subtitle="Scale by Population") +
  theme_opts

# v3

girafe( ggobj = v1, width_svg = 12, height_svg = 6,
  options = list( opts_sizing(rescale = TRUE) )
)

```


## Save output to file


